document.discussion_title: Woman OD's following goodbye party for friends
document.topic_text: Posted: 12:42 a.m. Friday, Aug. 12, 2016 Woman OD's following goodbye party for friends Became one of first to use new state law allowing doctor-assisted suicide A woman holds a two-day party for her friends and relatives to say goodbye before taking her life with prescribed drugs. 41-year old Betsy Davis had ALS, or Lou Gehrig's Disease. She became one of the first Californians to make use of a new state law allowing doctor-assisted suicide. She shared her plans with her guests, including the hour she planned to slip into a coma. But first, there were cocktails, pizza and a screening of one of her favorite movies.

She became one of the first Californians to make use of a new state law allowing doctor-assisted suicide. She shared her plans with her guests, including the hour she planned to slip into a coma. But first, there were cocktails, pizza and a screening of one of her favorite movies.
